page.title: 10THE POLSTRONG-ST.ERTH ROAD
page.content: This section of road was opened in November 1984 as a diversion on the main A30 trunk road.It was designed to improve the traffic flow to the popular tourist centres of West Penwith.A considerable amount of farm land was lost and the effect on wildlife was at first fairly devestating.It was a fairly common sight at first to see the squashed corpses of rabbits,hedgehogs and even foxes.The road varies from dual carriageway to three-lane and single carriageway and back again and is considered by many to be somewhat dangerous.The road will be fully tested very soon as the tourist traffic reaches its peak
